title: Discretisation of Maxwell-Bloch dynamical systems

references.title: A completely integrable 3-level Maxwell-Bloch system with rotational degeneracy’,
references.raw: J. M. Arnold, ‘A completely integrable 3-level Maxwell-Bloch system with rotational degeneracy’, International Conference on Electromagnetics in Advanced Applications (ICEAA), Torino, Italy, September 10-14, 2001.

references.title: Dynamical systems in nonlinear optics: reduced Maxwell-Bloch models’,
references.raw: J. M. Arnold, ‘Dynamical systems in nonlinear optics: reduced Maxwell-Bloch models’, Optical and Quantum Electronics, 40, 787, 2009.

references.title: Integrable systems and inverse scattering, in Hitchen, Segal, Ward, Integrable Systems: Twistors, Loop Groups and Riemann Surfaces, Oxford Graduate Texts in Mathematics 4,
references.raw: G. B. Segal, Integrable systems and inverse scattering, in Hitchen, Segal, Ward, Integrable Systems: Twistors, Loop Groups and Riemann Surfaces, Oxford Graduate Texts in Mathematics 4, Clarendon Publications, 1999.

references.title: Optical resonance and 2-level atoms,
references.raw: L. Allen and J. H. Eberly, Optical resonance and 2-level atoms, Dover, 1987.

abstract: We investigate the smallest possible physically meaningful RMB model, which models propagation through a thin slab of resonant atomic material placed in a recirculating cavity, which has 2 degrees of freedom in the spatial distribution of the field . The model may be used to determine the stationary states of the cavity field, which are then subjected to stability analysis
